content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

ðŸ“„ Here's how you can do that in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width = 10)
    result = String[]
    count = 0

    for word in words
        if (count + length(word) + 1 > text_width)
            push!(result, "\n")
            count = 0
        end

        push!(result, word)
        count += length(word) + 1
    end

    join(result)
end

# Example usage:
words = ["Here", "is", "an", "example"]
println(wrap_string(words))
```
This code will iterate over words, and each time it encounters a word that would take the total length of the line to more than `text_width`, it will add a new line. If you try this with different values for `text_width` or a different list of `words`, you'll get a different result. ðŸ’¡
